alert.note: Alert for Kimball (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 28 at 11:46PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Kimball County through 1115 PM MDT... At 1046 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Oliver Campground, or 12 miles west of Kimball, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Oliver Reservoir, Oliver Campground and Bushnell. This includes Interstate 80 in Nebraska between mile markers 2 and 17. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
